name: Guava Barbeque Sauce
author: Amber
summary: One of the best slathers for ribs and ham. Its exotic fruitiness goes well with chicken, turkey, duck and even game. Guava paste is much beloved by Cuban Americans, Puerto Ricans, and South Americans too!
ingredients: ¼  scotch bonnet chile pepper (or to taste), minced
kosher salt and pepper to taste
directions: Place the water, guava paste, vinegar, rum, tomato paste, lemon juice, onion, ginger, soy sauce, ketchup, Worcestershire sauce, garlic, and scotch bonnet pepper into a saucepan
Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat, whisking until evenly blended
Season to taste with salt and pepper
Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until the sauce has slightly thickened and is richly flavored, 10 to 15 minutes
If it has become too thick, thin it with some water
